course_content.core:
Students study three subjects (plus English for students with English as a second language) during the two-year A level qualification, choosing one from each subject block: September Start Subjects Block A : Biology, Chemistry, Economics, French, Geography, History, Physics, Psychology, Sociology
Block B : Biology, Chemistry, Economics, Photography, Physics, Psychology
Block C : Business, Chemistry, Economics, Art, History, Physics, Sociology
Block D : Business, Fast Track Mathematics, Maths
Block E : Fast Track Mathematics, Maths
Block F : Fast Track Mathematics, Maths

UFP students select one subject from each block – up to a maximum of three subjects. Non-native speakers will also study English as a Second Language. Final UFP grades are determined by exams at the end of the qualification, as well as a significant amount of coursework which simulates the structure of most UK university courses. i.e.: 30% coursework (Coursework 1 and 2)
40% examination (Controlled assessment)

course_content.core:
The IB curriculum is made up of the Diploma Core and six Subject Groups. Students study six subjects during the two-year IB course, choosing one from each subject block.  Three Elements of the Diploma Core Theory of Knowledge : The Theory of Knowledge asks you to reflect on the nature of knowledge and on how we know what we claim to know. It is assessed through an oral presentation and a 1,600-word essay.
Extended Essay : The extended essay prepares you for the study skills required at university.
Creativity, Activity, Service : Creativity, Activity, Service comprises arts and other experiences that involve creative thinking; physical exertion contributing to a healthy lifestyle, which improves and complements your academic studies; and an unpaid/voluntary exchange that has a learning benefit. Theory of Knowledge : The Theory of Knowledge asks you to reflect on the nature of knowledge and on how we know what we claim to know. It is assessed through an oral presentation and a 1,600-word essay. Theory of Knowledge Extended Essay : The extended essay prepares you for the study skills required at university. Extended Essay Creativity, Activity, Service : Creativity, Activity, Service comprises arts and other experiences that involve creative thinking; physical exertion contributing to a healthy lifestyle, which improves and complements your academic studies; and an unpaid/voluntary exchange that has a learning benefit. Creativity, Activity, Service  Six Subject Groups Block A : English Language: Self-taught
Block B : English, French Ab In*, Spanish Ab In*
Block C : Biology, Environmental Systems and Societies, Physics
Block D : Maths AA, Maths AI
Block E : Economics, Global Politics, Psychology
Block F : Chemistry, History, Visual Arts Block A : English Language: Self-taught Block A Block B : English, French Ab In*, Spanish Ab In* Block B  Block C : Biology, Environmental Systems and Societies, Physics Block C Block D : Maths AA, Maths AI Block D Block E : Economics, Global Politics, Psychology Block E Block F : Chemistry, History, Visual Arts Block F
